intro: Cyathocalyx tsukayae, commonly known as the Japanese cyathocalyx, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to Japan and is characterized by its distinctive, cup-shaped inflorescence known as a cyathium. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests or along stream banks. Its flowers are small and often clustered, with a unique structure that aids in pollination by insects. The leaves are simple and alternate, with a rough texture that distinguishes it from other members of the family.
